DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate safety , tolerability , pharmacokinetics , pharmacodynamics PF-06817024 healthy volunteer may mildly atopic participant chronic rhinosinusitis nasal polyp
DOC.brief_title: Study Of PF-06817024 In Healthy Subjects And In Patients With Chronic Rhinosinusitis With Nasal Polyps
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Healthy male subject , healthy female subject nonchildbearing potential , 1855 year age ( Part 1 ) Male subject , female subject nonchildbearing potential , female subject childbearing potential documented bilateral tubal ligation ( tubes tie ) bilateral salpingectomy ( tubes remove ) , 1865 year age , 2 follow symptom : nasal congestion/obstruction , nasal discharge , face pain/pressure , reduction/loss smell ( Part 2 ) Clinically significant disease ( cardiac , psychiatric , autoimmune , renal , etc . ) , positive urine drug test , fever within 7 day dose , active infection within 28 day dose ( Part 1 2 ) History allergic reaction topical lidocaine , nasal surgery within 6 month ( Part 2 )
